title: Cup, ca. 1100 BC
provenance: James Hazen Hyde; No. 366 in Parke-Bernet Galleries sale no. 1939, January 1960.
dimensions: H x diam.: 8 x 5 cm (3 1/8 x 1 15/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Narrow bell-shaped body on tall flaring foot.  Black design of pointed petals, rising from wavy line near bottom, on brilliant glossy, turqoise-colored body.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cup, ca. 1100 BC.
ca. 1100 BC. Faience (ceramic frit). Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1960-29-1.
